== Possible source ==
There's an early description of the ship, translated from an Argentine newspaper, [http://books.google.com/books?id=nfRYAAAAYAAJ&pg=RA19-PA15 on Google Books]. [[User:The ed17|Ed]] <sup>[[User talk:The ed17|[talk]]] [[WP:OMT|[majestic titan]]]</sup> 16:54, 29 July 2014 (UTC)
== Barbette ==
I don't understand the terminology involving barbette. I did go to the Article [[Barbette]] - BTW, shouldn't there be a wlink to that? But the days-of-the-week barbettes don't mean anything to me. What is a "Monday" barbette, etc.? [[User:TomS TDotO|TomS TDotO]] ([[User talk:TomS TDotO|talk]]) 02:03, 22 January 2016 (UTC)
It was simply the naming system adopted. Instead of 1, 2, 3, or A, B, C, the turrets were called Sunday, Monday, Tuesday ...[[User:Peter Bell|Peter Bell]] ([[User talk:Peter Bell|talk]]) 05:42, 22 January 2016 (UTC)
:Thank you. I see now that there were seven turrets. I'm going to mention this, as well as the wlink. [[User:TomS TDotO|TomS TDotO]] ([[User talk:TomS TDotO|talk]]) 06:42, 22 January 2016 (UTC) ::Oh, I see that this was mentioned in the article and I'd missed it. Sorry. But I did wlink [[barbette]]. Thanks for your patience. [[User:TomS TDotO|TomS TDotO]] ([[User talk:TomS TDotO|talk]]) 06:58, 22 January 2016 (UTC)
